0.title: Man held for allegedly trying to run over judge's wife in Ayodhya
0.article_body: A 45-year-old man was arrested after he allegedly tried to run over a judge's wife and driver following an argument over parking in Ayodhya. The driver alleged that "when they reached the school to pick judge's daughter, the accused attempted to run over them in his SUV". A case was lodged against Manuj Malhotra on charges of attempt to murder.

1.title: I don't think I've ability to write, I'm fascinated by people who can: Shahid
1.article_body: When asked whether he has thought about writing or directing a film just like his father Pankaj Kapur, actor Shahid Kapoor said, "I don't think I have the ability to write. I'm fascinated by people who can." "As for direction, I am very focussed on what I am doing...I am not ready to give up acting right now," Shahid added.

2.title: We have ensured that Fadnavis never return as CM: Sharad Pawar
2.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar took a dig at former Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis at an event in Osmanabad. "Some people don't know that politics should not be done during difficult times. Before elections, only he [Fadnavis] was saying that he will be back as CM," Pawar said. "Now, we have ensured that he will never return as CM," added Pawar.

3.title: Mumbai Police arrest gangster with 37 cases against him in B'luru
3.article_body: A man with 37 cases registered against him including serious offences such as murder, has been arrested from Bengaluru, Karnataka. The Criminal Intelligence Unit (CIU) of the Mumbai crime branch arrested Iliyas Abdul Aziz Khan alias Iliyas Bachakana from a hotel in Hosur after he was found hiding there. Other cases against him include attempt to murder, robbery and extortion.

4.title: Radhe Shyam isn't inspired by Titanic, it's a different story: Pooja Hegde
4.article_body: Speaking about the comparisons between her film 'Radhe Shyam' and 'Titanic', actress Pooja Hegde said that it's a big compliment to achieve that scale and be like it. She added, "But, Radhe Shyam is not inspired by Titanic. It's a different story." "The only similarity is the ship in the middle of the sea, and something is happening," Pooja said.

5.title: S Korean actress Han So-hee's agency responds to mom's fraud case
5.article_body: South Korean actress Han So-hee's agency responded to fraud case involving her mother, stating she won't take responsibility for the debt. Her mother had opened a bank account in her name when she was a minor and used it to borrow money without her knowledge. "There was even a case involving the forgery of a private document," the agency stated.

6.title: Shabana shares pic of Javed's 'cluttered' desk, says he uses trolley to write on
6.article_body: Shabana Azmi took to Instagram and shared a picture of Javed Akhtar's "cluttered" study table. "Javed's study. Always so cluttered that he has to use a food trolley (peaking from right-hand corner) to write on instead of his desk," she wrote. Reacting to her post, a user wrote, "The genius' desk," while another user wrote, "I'm feeling dizzy looking at...table."

7.title: Actors have come & gone, junior artists remain in every frame: Big B
7.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan took to his blog to praise the work of junior artists in the film industry, writing, "Actors and actresses have come and gone but they remain in every frame!" The actor shared a series of pictures showing his interaction with the artists. He further wrote that some of them have been around since before he began his journey.

8.title: ED, CBI take action on people before they join BJP: Mumbai Mayor
8.article_body: Mumbai Mayor Kishori Pednekar criticised BJP for allegedly using central agencies to settle political scores. "ED, CBI and IT Dept take action against people and if they join BJP, they get clean," said Pednekar. The reaction is part of her verbal spat with BJP MLA Nitesh Rane who was recently interrogated by Mumbai Police in connection with Disha Salian's death.

9.title: Microplastics found in fish caught off Mumbai coast: Study
9.article_body: Researchers have found microplastics less than 100 microns in size in gastrointestinal tracts and gills of croaker fish caught off Mumbai’s coast. According to the Central Institute of Fisheries Education (CIFE) research, the microplastics found in fish tissue were predominantly black and blue in colour. It poses a carcinogenic risk to consumers and organisms in food chain, the study added.

10.title: MG introduces the all-new ZS EV seeking to change mindsets about EVs
10.article_body: The recently launched ZS EV features a 50.3 kWh advanced battery with 176PS of power and driving range of 461 km* in a single charge, MG revealed. It is equipped with LED headlamps, a 10.1” HD infotainment screen, and digital Bluetooth key while its advanced safety package includes blind-spot detection, lane change assist and rear cross-traffic alert.

11.title: 10 students of UP polytechnic college injured in gas cylinder blast at hostel
11.article_body: Ten students were injured in a gas cylinder explosion inside the hostel of a government polytechnic college in Uttar Pradesh's Bulandshahr on Monday, police said. The incident took place when a five-kilogram cylinder exploded while food was being cooked inside the kitchen, police added. Bulandshahr DM said the injured persons have been sent to a government medical college in Aligarh.

12.title: Anamika is my evil twin: Madhuri on her character in 'The Fame Game'
12.article_body: When asked about her character 'Anamika Anand' in show 'The Fame Game', actress Madhuri Dixit said her on-screen character differs from her real self. Madhuri added 'Anamika' wouldn't be able to deal with things as she does. "She'd be a mess if she walks into a room and nobody recognises her, she'll go mad. She's...my evil twin," Madhuri said.

13.title: Capt Amarinder Singh meets Amit Shah ahead of Punjab polls result
13.article_body: Punjab Lok Congress President Captain Amarinder Singh met Union Home Minister Amit Shah in Delhi on Monday. When quipped on the alliance's performance in Punjab assembly elections, Singh said, "My party and BJP has done well. Let us see what happens." The PLC is in an alliance with BJP along with Shiromani Akali Dal (Sanyukt) for the Punjab polls.

14.title: Traffic rules' violators in Noida to get e-fines from April 15
14.article_body: Commuters violating traffic rules in Noida will be issued electronic fines from April 15, 2022, as part of the Noida authority's intelligent traffic management system (ITMS) project. A budget of ₹64.49 crore has been set aside for the project, which will put 84 traffic intersections under e-surveillance in the city with a total of 1,065 cameras, officials said.

15.title: Ukraine rejects humanitarian corridors leading to Russia & Belarus, calls it 'immoral'
15.article_body: Ukraine has rejected humanitarian corridors proposed by Russia that allowed people to exit to Russia and Belarus. President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's spokesperson called the move "immoral" and said Russia was trying to "use people's suffering to create a television picture". "They are citizens of Ukraine, they should have the right to evacuate to the territory of Ukraine," the spokesperson added.

16.title: What is the co-location case for which ex-NSE CEO Chitra has been arrested?
16.article_body: The NSE co-location case refers to a series of events wherein some brokers received preferential access through the co-location facility, resulting in faster access to the markets. The matter came to light after a whistleblower wrote to SEBI in 2015. The NSE co-location facilities were launched in 2009 while Chitra Ramkrishna was appointed as the Joint MD the same year.

17.title: Want him to go through journey without my backing: Salil Ankola on son's career
17.article_body: Actor Salil Ankola said he wants his son Karan Ankola to go through the journey of making his career without his backing. "When you achieve success after struggling for it relentlessly, you feel proud of yourself. I am very happy that his efforts are always getting noticed and appreciated," 'The Power' actor said.

18.title: IMD predicts overcast weather, rainfall in Delhi on March 9-10
18.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted overcast weather and light rainfall in Delhi on March 9 and 10. During this period, light rainfall is also expected in districts of Punjab and Haryana. The rainfall will be due to the western disturbance that is likely to affect the Western Himalayan region from the night of March 8.

19.title: Kangana celebrates 8 yrs of 'Queen'; shares old pic with Virat, Dhoni
19.article_body: Kangana Ranaut took to Instagram Stories on Monday to share a post celebrating eight years of her film 'Queen'. She shared a throwback picture, wherein she's seen doing a step from the song 'London Thumakda' with Virat Kohli, MS Dhoni, Ajinkya Rahane, Ravichandran Ashwin and Stuart Binny. "On this day...a film came called Queen...and it changed my life," Kangana wrote.

20.title: May God keep you safe: Kirron Kher wishes husband Anupam on 67th b'day
20.article_body: Actor-politician Kirron Kher wished her husband-actor, Anupam Kher, on his 67th birthday. Taking to Instagram, Kirron shared a picture with Anupam from an event and captioned it, "Many many happy returns of the day dearest @anupampkher, husband, friend, support and my love. God bless you and keep you safe and healthy always."

21.title: Warne's cricket knowledge separated him from everyone else: Clarke
21.article_body: Talking about Shane Warne, who passed away aged 52 on Friday, former Australia captain Michael Clarke told The Sydney Morning Herald, "Warne's knowledge around the game separated him from everyone else I played with." "Warne lived his life at such a fast pace that he nearly created this invincible feeling around him," he added.

22.title: Was told I'll be made Prez if I didn't speak in favour of protesting farmers: Malik
22.article_body: Meghalaya Governor Satya Pal Malik has claimed that 'some of his friends' in the BJP told him that he will be given the post of India's President if he didn't speak in support of farmers protesting against the three farm laws. "They tried to lure me...but I turned down all their proposals and spoke in favour of farmers," said Malik.

23.title: People say, 'Oh God, we want to work you' and then nothing happens: Shefali
23.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah said she gets a lot of appreciation for her performances but that doesn't translate into work offers. She added, "[People say] 'Oh god we want to work with you'. 'Really? I want to work with you too' and then nothing happens." "Then I see [them] at...next party and say the exactly same thing...It's really boring," she said.

24.title: South African cricketers face test of loyalty ahead of IPL: Elgar
24.article_body: South Africa Test skipper Dean Elgar said his teammates need to choose between national duty in a series against Bangladesh, beginning March 18, and upcoming IPL as it's a loyalty test for them. "They mustn't forget that Test...or one-day cricket got them into...IPL and not...other way around," he added. Series will end on April 12. IPL begins on March 26.

25.title: Close friends Viv Richards, Ian Botham unveil trophy for WI-England Tests
25.article_body: Former competitors and close friends Sir Vivian Richards and Ian Botham unveiled the Richards-Botham Trophy for the upcoming Test series between the West Indies and England on Sunday. The Cricket West Indies tweeted, "Courage. Friendship. Respect. - values that represent the cricketing Test rivalry between West Indies and England." Both of them played together for the Somerset CCC.

26.title: Stalker attacks woman with acid for rejecting his advances in Guj
26.article_body: A 39-year-old woman was attacked with acid after she allegedly rejected the advances of a stalker in Gujarat's Ahmedabad on Sunday. The accused, an autorickshaw driver, used to drop the woman at her workplace so they'd shared numbers, a police official said. The accused stalked the woman after she left her workplace then threw acid, the police official added.

27.title: Virat Kohli developed the Indian pace bowling attack: Gambhir
27.article_body: Ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir said that Virat Kohli developed the Indian pace bowling attack, adding Kohli has passed on a better fast bowling combination to captain Rohit Sharma than what the ex-captain got from MS Dhoni. "Their actual development, whether it was related to fitness or skill- Umesh Yadav or Mohammad Shami...I'm sure that would've been Kohli's thinking," he added.

28.title: PM inaugurates art gallery dedicated to cartoonist RK Laxman in Pune
28.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday virtually inaugurated a modern art gallery-cum-museum in Pune dedicated to cartoonist RK Laxman, who is best known for his creation 'The Common Man'. The gallery has a miniature model based on the village of Malgudi. The art gallery also has over 30,000 sketches made by Laxman.

29.title: Ashwin comes into every series with different thinking: Sanjay Bangar
29.article_body: Former Team India batting coach Sanjay Bangar has said that his biggest challenge with off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin was that the 35-year-old came into every series with different thinking. "If we see the last two years, there was a time when he tried to bowl a lot with a front-on action...but [against Sri Lanka] he was bowling absolutely side-on," Bangar explained.

30.title: BSF jawan shoots himself after killing colleague at camp in West Bengal
30.article_body: A Border Security Force (BSF) jawan allegedly shot himself after killing his colleague at a camp in West Bengal's Murshidabad district on Monday, officials said. The duo got into a scuffle after receiving summons from the local police, according to officials. This comes a day after five BSF personnel were killed in a fratricide incident at a camp in Amritsar.

31.title: Second edition of Durgam Cheruvu marathon held in Hyderabad
31.article_body: The second edition of the Durgam Cheruvu marathon was held in Hyderabad on Sunday. The marathon was organised by Inorbit Mall in Hyderabad and inaugurated by MAUD Special Chief Secretary Arvind Kumar. Over 3,500 people had registered to run in the marathon this year, Kumar tweeted while sharing pictures from the event.

32.title: Alia in talks with Rajamouli for his next film with Mahesh Babu: Report
32.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt is in talks with 'RRR' director SS Rajamouli for his upcoming jungle adventure featuring Mahesh Babu in the lead role, according to a report. "Unlike 'RRR', Alia will be having a bigger role in this African jungle adventure," Pinkvilla said quoting a source. 'RRR', starring Jr NTR and Ram Charan, features Alia in an extended cameo appearance.

33.title: Shane Warne died of natural causes, shows autopsy
33.article_body: Former Australia cricketer Shane Warne, who passed away on an island in Thailand on Friday, died due to natural causes, an autopsy showed. "Investigators will summarize the autopsy result for prosecutors within the timeframe of the law," the police said. Warne's family were told of the result and had accepted the finding, the police added.

34.title: Shane Warne's last meal was Vegemite on toast, reveals friend; shares pics
34.article_body: Shane Warne's friend Tom Hall, who is the CEO of The Sporting News, revealed that Warne's last meal was Vegemite on toast. "[While eating] Warne said, 'Geez, you can’t beat Vegemite with some butter, always great wherever you are in the world'," Hall revealed. Hall added that Warne went to bedroom to call his kids after having the meal.

35.title: I don't think Virat Kohli will captain RCB again: Daniel Vettori
35.article_body: Ahead of IPL 2022, former RCB captain Daniel Vettori said, "I don't think Virat Kohli will captain RCB again." He added that Faf du Plessis, Dinesh Karthik, Glenn Maxwell and Kohli could form RCB's leadership group. "I don't think [becoming captain again after giving up captaincy] ever works. Once...captain has moved on...the right thing is for him to move on."

36.title: Sensex ends nearly 1,500 points lower at 52,842, Nifty settles below 15,900
36.article_body: The Sensex plunged 1,491 points to close at 52,842 while the Nifty settled at 15,863 after falling 382 points on Monday amid weak global cues. The sharp fall comes as crude oil prices surged past the $130-per-barrel mark amid heightened tensions between Russia and Ukraine. Metal index gained over 2%, while auto, bank, FMCG, PSU bank and realty fell 2-5%.

37.title: 188 Chhattisgarh students have returned from Ukraine: State govt
37.article_body: As many as 188 students from Chhattisgarh who were in Ukraine have returned to India, state government said on Sunday. Students are being provided food and lodging in Delhi and will be given tickets to return to their hometowns, an official said. Efforts were made to stay in touch with stranded students since February 22, Chhattisgarh's Joint Resident Commissioner said.

38.title: ITBP troops help elderly voters during UP polls; video surfaces
38.article_body: Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) on Monday shared a video of its troops helping elderly and differently-abled voters cast their votes during the 7th phase of the Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections. The troops were seen helping voters at polling booths in Varanasi, Jaunpur and Sonbhadra, among others. The video shows personnel helping elderly people who'd arrived at polling booths on wheelchairs.

39.title: India Women played the sort of match they were expecting vs Pak: Gambhir
39.article_body: Following a 107-run win over Pakistan in the Women's ODI World Cup on Sunday, ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir said India Women played the sort of match they were expecting. "You want to play such...match at the start where your...batting order is tested, your capability is tested...you're also tested in the bowling department because it wasn't a huge total," Gambhir stated.

40.title: Test series vs WI isn't going to be easy for us: England's Woakes
40.article_body: England fast bowler Chris Woakes said that the three-match Test series against West Indies is not going to be easy for his side. "We haven't won a lot of Test matches here in the last 50 or 60 years...so it's not by any means going to be a walkover," he added. The first Test match will be played in Antigua.

41.title: Man molests 5-yr-old girl in Pune, threatens her to keep quiet; held
41.article_body: The Pimpri-Chinchwad Police arrested a 40-year-old man for allegedly molesting minor girls. The incident came to light when the mother of a victim lodged complaint with police on Sunday. The accused molested the five-year-old girl by touching her inappropriately and also threatened her to keep quiet about the incident. He had also molested another six-year-old girl about a week ago.

42.title: 21 kg ganja worth ₹4 lakh seized from train passenger in Bengaluru
42.article_body: Around 21 kg ganja estimated to be valued at ₹4 lakh was seized from a passenger on Kakinada Express after it reached the Bengaluru Cantonment Railway Station, the Government Railway Police, Karnataka said. The passenger was carrying 16 kg of the contraband in a suitcase and 5 kg of it in another travel bag. Police said he has been arrested.

43.title: China will provide humanitarian aid to Ukraine: Foreign Minister
43.article_body: China will send humanitarian aid to Ukraine very soon, Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi said on Monday, while adding that China's ties with Russia are "rock solid". Yi said "humanitarian action" must abide by principles of neutrality and impartiality. Notably, China has refused to call Russia's attack on Ukraine an 'invasion' and asked West to address its "legitimate security concerns".

44.title: NZ players to miss Netherlands series for IPL 2022: NZ head coach
44.article_body: New Zealand head coach Gary Stead confirmed that New Zealand players, who are part of the IPL franchises, will be available for IPL 2022. "They won't be available for the Netherlands series," Stead added. New Zealand will host the Netherlands for one T20I and three ODIs. The tour will begin with T20I which will be played on March 25.

45.title: Open to post-poll alliance with non-BJP parties: Cong’s ahead of Goa poll results
45.article_body: Ahead of the Goa Assembly poll results, Congress said it is open to a post-poll alliance with parties other than BJP to form the next government if it doesn’t get a majority on its own. AICC’s Goa desk in-charge, Dinesh Gundu Rao, said Congress is open to seeking the support of parties like AAP, MGP and TMC to form government.

46.title: German woman spends 40 seconds alone in ambulance carrying Warne's body, police to probe
46.article_body: Thai police are investigating after a German woman got into the back of the ambulance transporting the body of late Australian cricketer Shane Warne from Koh Samui island. The woman, carrying a bunch of flowers, was allowed to spend about 40 seconds alone in the van, raising questions about security. Warne's friends in Thailand reportedly couldn't identify the woman.

47.title: Ashneer tried to create a false narrative about BharatPe: Co-founder Shashvat
47.article_body: BharatPe's Co-founder Shashvat Nakrani in a letter to the company's employees said, "Ashneer Grover tried to create a false narrative about the company that we've built together with the right spirit." He added, "I am proud of the fact that our board acted quickly and decisively to uphold good corporate governance." BharatPe removed Ashneer from all positions on March 2.

48.title: 8 including 2 women injured as 2 groups clash with lathis, stones in UP
48.article_body: Eight persons, including two women, were injured in a clash between two groups in Uttar Pradesh's Shamli district, police said on Monday. According to police, the incident took place when one group confronted two persons for allegedly harassing a woman. The situation turned violent after the two groups clashed with lathis and stones, police added.

49.title: PM speaks to Putin for 50 minutes, urges direct talks with Ukrainian Prez: Report
49.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday spoke on the phone with Russian President Vladimir Putin on the situation in Ukraine and the call lasted around 50 minutes, ANI reported. Putin briefed PM Modi about the status of negotiations between Ukrainian and Russian teams and PM urged President Putin to hold direct talks with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, it further reported.

50.title: Former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna sent to 7-day CBI custody in co-location scam
50.article_body: A Delhi court granted the CBI seven-day custodial interrogation of former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna in the co-location case on Monday. The probe agency had sought 14-day custody of Ramkrishna, who is also accused of sharing confidential information with a 'Himalayan yogi'. She was arrested by the CBI in Delhi on Sunday, a day after her anticipatory bail was denied.

51.title: 30 of 36 disputed villages along Meghalaya-Assam border to remain in Meghalaya: CM
51.article_body: Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma on Monday informed the Assembly that 30 of the 36 disputed villages along the Meghalaya-Assam border will remain in Meghalaya, as recommended by regional committees of the two states. "Ownership of land, however, will not be affected after demarcation of the boundary," Sangma said. The 30 villages cover an area of 18 square kilometres.

52.title: I don't chew tobacco, had to put cotton in mouth for 'Love Hostel' role: Bobby
52.article_body: Bobby Deol has said the most challenging part of playing Dagar in 'Love Hostel' was the language. "I'd to learn Haryanvi...I'd to get it right," he added. Bobby further said he also had to use a lot of prosthetics. "Since this character chews tobacco (I don't) I'd to put cotton in my mouth to look as I do," said Bobby.

53.title: Russia-Ukraine conflict moment of choice for China: Australia PM
53.article_body: Australian PM Scott Morrison said on Monday that the Russia and Ukraine conflict is a "moment of choice for China". He added that the world has heard China's words about its "commitment to global peace and respect for sovereignty" and now it is time for the country to demonstrate it. He also urged China to put sanctions on Russia.

54.title: Pune's SPPU likely to restart heritage tour to underground tunnel
54.article_body: The Savitribai Phule Pune University is likely to restart the guided heritage tour to the underground tunnel at the university, officials said. The tour was discontinued for over two years due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The tunnel was discovered during the restoration work of the main building in 2018.

55.title: Microsoft to set up its largest Indian data centre region in Hyderabad
55.article_body: Microsoft on Monday said it plans to establish its largest Indian data centre region in Hyderabad, with its first phase expected to become operational by 2025. Microsoft India President Anant Maheshwari said the company is making long-term investments and that it has doubled its existing three data centres' capacity. “We already serve more than 3,40,000 companies in India,” he said.

56.title: Elections for 13 Rajya Sabha seats to be held on March 31: EC
56.article_body: Elections for 13 Rajya Sabha seats will be held on March 31 this year, the Election Commission announced on Monday. The seats are spread across six states – five in Punjab, three in Kerala, two in Assam and one each in Himachal Pradesh, Tripura, and Nagaland. The term of office of 13 RS members is due to expire in April.

57.title: Hope to be half as great as you: Masaba on dad Vivian Richard's 70th b'day
57.article_body: Fashion designer Masaba Gupta wished her father, former West Indies cricketer Vivian Richards on his 70th birthday and shared a throwback picture with him. Taking to Instagram, Masaba wrote, "My father is unrelenting [and] focussed...[He] has lived his life in the pursuit of greatness...I set out in my pursuit to be even half as great as you...Happy 70th birthday papa!"

58.title: I hope Ashwin breaks Kumble's record of 619 Test wickets: Nikhil Chopra
58.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Nikhil Chopra has said he wants off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin to break Anil Kumble's record of being the top wicket-taker for India in Tests. "Kumble would be [himself] wishing that a spinner breaks his record. Just like Kumble, Ashwin has developed a reputation to win matches for the team at home," Nikhil added. Currently, Ashwin has 436 Test wickets.

59.title: Taron Egerton faints during performance in London, says he's 'completely fine'
59.article_body: Actor Taron Egerton fainted during the maiden performance of his new play in London. Reports said that a doctor from the crowd rushed to the stage to help the 32-year-old actor. The play's director assured the audience actor was "absolutely fine". However, he could not continue the performance. Egerton shared an update on Instagram, saying he is "completely fine".

60.title: Captain Fresh doubles valuation in 3 months as it raises $50 mn
60.article_body: Business-to-business (B2B) seafood marketplace Captain Fresh has more than doubled its valuation to $500 million in three months after raising $50 million in Series C funding round. Co-led by Prosus Ventures and Tiger Global, it saw participation from existing investors Accel India, Matrix Partners India, Ankur Capital and Incubate Fund. The startup was valued at about $200 million in December.

61.title: Delhi High Court dismisses plea for virtual court proceedings
61.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Monday dismissed a plea seeking direction to take sufficient steps to adopt virtual court proceedings through video conferencing as a norm. The counsels, litigations, parties and courts should be at liberty to proceed in any matter through virtual courts if the physical appearance is not really necessary, the plea stated.

62.title: Clothing is a necessity, Russians have right to live: Uniqlo as it stays open in Russia
62.article_body: Fast Retailing, the parent company of Japanese clothing brand Uniqlo, on Monday defended its decision to keep the Russian stores open amid rival brands suspending operations in the country over the invasion of Ukraine. Tadashi Yanai, President of Fast Retailing, said, "Clothing is a necessity of life. The people of Russia have the same right to live as we do."

63.title: Pornographic content found in phone of Chhattisgarh journalist held over fake news
63.article_body: The Chhattisgarh Police has claimed to have found "pornographic content and sensitive confidential documents" from the phone of a Raipur-based journalist, who was recently arrested for allegedly spreading fake news against ruling Congress leaders. Police alleged that the chats recovered from his phone were found to be objectionable, abusive and also of the nature of intimidation.

64.title: Was told I'd get Prez post if I didn't speak on farmers' issue: Malik
64.article_body: Meghalaya Governor Satya Pal Malik claimed on Sunday while addressing a gathering in Haryana's Jind that he was told that he'd be given the President post if he didn't speak on the farmers' issue. "I turned down all their proposals...These posts of governor and president are nothing," he said. He also urged farmers to unite and form their own government.

65.title: Mumbai to get 25 new bus routes to improve connectivity with metro
65.article_body: Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) plans to introduce 25 new bus routes for passengers of Dahisar and DN Nagar Metro 2-A line to improve metro's last mile connectivity. BEST also plans to relocate some bus stands and stops between Dahisar and Andheri closer to the metro stations. BEST may introduce 175 new routes as other metro corridors become operational.

66.title: B'luru women take out rally for fundamental rights amid hijab issue
66.article_body: Several women took out a march in Bengaluru for women's right to education, dignity and choice amid the hijab controversy on Sunday. The rally began from the Café Coffee Day Square on Vittal Mallya Road and ended at Town Hall with the protesters. Some women were dressed as social reformers Fatima Sheikh and Savitribai Phule.

67.title: 'President Zelensky Way' sign posted outside Russian Embassy in US, pic goes viral
67.article_body: A photo of a road sign reading 'President Zelensky Way' outside the Russian Embassy on Wisconsin Avenue, Washington, DC has gone viral on social media. Activists placed the sign outside the Russian Embassy on Sunday afternoon in honour of Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. Notably, Zelenskyy had earlier refused US offer to evacuate him, saying "I need ammunition, not a ride."

68.title: Netflix suspends its services, TikTok blocks new uploads in Russia
68.article_body: Netflix has announced that it is suspending its services in Russia after the country launched the invasion of Ukraine. Additionally, China's ByteDance-owned TikTok is blocking livestreaming and uploading of new content after Russia passed a law criminalising spreading of "fake news" about its army. Netflix earlier said it was temporarily stopping all future projects and acquisitions in Russia.

69.title: Informed PM Modi about Ukraine countering Russia, grateful for support: Zelenskyy
69.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Monday said he informed Indian PM Narendra Modi about "Ukraine countering Russian aggression" after reports said the two leaders spoke on the phone. "India appreciates the assistance to its citizens during the war and Ukraine's commitment to direct peaceful dialogue at the highest level. Grateful for the support to the Ukrainian people," said Zelenskyy.

70.title: Indian rupee hits its lowest level against the US dollar
70.article_body: The Indian rupee hit its lowest level against the US dollar as it opened at ₹76.96 on Monday compared to a close of ₹76.17 on Friday. The rupee's previous low was at ₹76.91 in April 2020. The sharp fall comes amid soaring oil prices following the Russia-Ukraine conflict and continued outflows of foreign portfolio money.

71.title: I suffer from an ailment called onomatomania: Naseeruddin Shah
71.article_body: Actor Naseeruddin Shah, while speaking to YouTube channel Chalchitra Talks, revealed that he suffers from a condition called 'onomatomania'. The 71-year-old actor said, "Onomatomania is an ailment in which you keep repeating a word, a phrase, a sentence, a verse, or an entire speech for no reason at all." He added, "I do that all the time."

72.title: New Zealand defeat B'desh by 9 wickets to register their 1st win in Women's WC
72.article_body: New Zealand registered their first victory of ICC Women's ODI World Cup 2022 with a nine-wicket win against Bangladesh in a rain-affected match on Monday. Amy Satterthwaite picked three wickets as hosts New Zealand restricted Bangladesh to 140/8 in 27 overs. In response, Suzie Bates smashed 79* off 68 to help her side win the match.

73.title: 2.5 acres of forest in Karnataka's Bandipur Tiger Reserve gutted in fire
73.article_body: Over 2.5 acres of forest in Bandipur Tiger Reserve in the Chamarajanagar district of Karnataka was gutted in a fire that broke out on Sunday afternoon, forest officials said. According to officials, the blaze was brought under control and no wildlife was affected. The forest department has deployed 400 additional forest guards after the fire.

74.title: Man kills self in lockup after being caught with 7 stolen phones in Punjab
74.article_body: A day after he was caught with seven stolen mobile phones in Ludhiana, Ashish Kumar, of Punjab's Jalandhar, died by suicide in the lockup at Salem Tabri police station on Sunday. Kumar was rushed to the hospital where he was declared dead. A case was registered against Kumar under Section 379B of the IPC.

75.title: Anonymous hacks Russian streaming services, shows war footage from Ukraine
75.article_body: Hacker collective Anonymous on Monday hacked into streaming services and TV news channels in Russia to broadcast footage of the ongoing war in Ukraine. Anonymous tweeted that it hacked into streaming services Wink and Ivi (like Netflix) and live TV channels Russia 24, Channel One and Moscow 24. The footage called for Russians to oppose the attack in Ukraine.

76.title: Boney compares Hindi cinema to fast food, says 'South films offer thali'
76.article_body: When asked if Bollywood is being overshadowed by South cinema, producer Boney Kapoor said South films are a complete package of a family drama.  He added, "Today, some of the Mumbai filmmakers serve...KFC...where you get only what you order, whereas...South [films] offer you thali with roti, dal-chawal...chicken." "Most...South films are made for the Indian audience," Boney said.

77.title: Shreyas Talpade to play Pravin Tambe in cricketer's biopic
77.article_body: Shreyas Talpade will portray Mumbai's leg-spinner Pravin Tambe in a film based on the life of the cricketer. Titled 'Kaun Pravin Tambe?', the upcoming film will release on an OTT platform on April 1. Speaking about the film, Pravin said, "My family and loved ones can't wait to see my story come alive...it's going to be a very special day."

78.title: Man Utd didn't create many problems and we played good: City coach Guardiola
78.article_body: Manchester City head coach Pep Guardiola has praised his side for "excellent display" in their 4-1 win against Manchester United. "I'm the biggest critic of my team, but [against United] we played really good. We struggled to make a better build up [in the first half] but I don't think they created many problems," he added.

79.title: Indian students were protesting in Ukraine, PM was playing damru: Saamana
79.article_body: Shiv Sena's mouthpiece Saamana said while Indian students were protesting in Sumy, Kyiv and Kharkiv in Ukraine, Prime Minister Modi was playing 'damru' on banks of river Ganga in Varanasi. It also reportedly said, "If this is what 'Operation Ganga' means then we bow before them." "We will also raise slogans in praise of you...keep politics aside for a while."

80.title: MG introduces the all-new ZS EV seeking to change mindsets about EVs
80.article_body: The recently launched ZS EV features a 50.3 kWh advanced battery with 176PS of power and driving range of 461 km* in a single charge, MG revealed. It is equipped with LED headlamps, a 25.7 cm HD infotainment screen, and digital Bluetooth key while its advanced safety package includes blind-spot detection, lane change assist and rear cross-traffic alert.

81.title: Ukraine evacuation named 'Op Ganga' as Varanasi is undergoing voting: Akhilesh
81.article_body: The operation to evacuate Indians from Ukraine was named "Operation Ganga" as Varanasi is also undergoing voting in UP Assembly polls, SP chief, Akhilesh Yadav, said. "Don't know which international recognition they boast about. They (BJP-led Centre) failed to evacuate Indians," Yadav added. "Had they rescued our people from Ukraine directly I would've appreciated it," Yadav stated.

82.title: Union Min launches 'Donate-a-Pension' scheme, donates to gardener
82.article_body: Union Labour Minister Bhupender Yadav on Monday launched the 'Donate-a-Pension' programme under the Pradhan Mantri Shram Yogi Maan-Dhan (PM-SYM) at his residence by donating to the gardener. The scheme allows people to donate a premium contribution to their support staff's pension fund. Under the PM-SYM, people receive an assured pension of a minimum of ₹3,000/month after the age of 60.

83.title: Ukrainians have plans in place: US on if Russia kills Ukraine President Zelenskyy
83.article_body: Ukraine has a contingency plan in case President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is killed by Russia, US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said. "The Ukrainians have plans in place - that I'm not going to talk about or get into any details on - to make sure there is what we would call 'continuity of government' one way or another," he said.

84.title: Ukrainian man, who attended Russia-Ukraine peace talks, found dead amid claims of spying
84.article_body: Denis Kireev, a member of Ukraine's negotiating team during first round of peace talks with Russia, was found dead amid claims he was a spy. Ukraine's Ministry of Defence said the 45-year-old was killed during an operation to "defend the nation" but some Ukrainian MPs claimed he was killed by Ukraine's security service after resisting arrest on suspicion of treason.

85.title: Union Minister calls Rahul Gandhi's tweets as 'a bundle of lies'
85.article_body: Union Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai has hit back at Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for criticising the Centre's evacuation efforts to bring back the Indians stranded in war-torn Ukraine. "Rahul Gandhi's tweet does not make any sense. It's a bundle of lies," he said, adding that PM Modi's efforts are being lauded by everyone.

86.title: Nitin Mukesh remembers Lata on 1-month death anniversary, shares old pics
86.article_body: Neil Nitin Mukesh's father and singer Nitin Mukesh took to Instagram on Sunday to remember Lata Mangeshkar on her one-month death anniversary. Sharing a few pictures with the late veteran singer, he wrote, "One month passed like one era. I love my didi." Lata passed away aged 92 due to multi-organ failure after being hospitalised for nearly a month.

87.title: Alia Bhatt, Ranveer Singh, Nia Sharma attend ITA awards 2022, pics surface
87.article_body: Several celebrities including actors Alia Bhatt, Ranveer Singh, Rashami Desai, Rakhi Sawant and Nia Sharma attended the 21st Indian Television Academy Awards, also known as ITA Awards, which was held in Mumbai on March 6, 2022. While Rakhi danced with Ranveer Singh on the red carpet. Alia Bhatt attended the event and greeted the paparazzi with her Gangubai Kathiawadi-style namaste.

88.title: BJP MLAs protest against MVA govt, demand Nawab Malik’s resignation
88.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) MLAs staged a protest at Maharashtra Assembly in Mumbai against the MVA government, demanding the resignation of state minister Nawab Malik. Earlier, former CM Devendra Fadnavis accused the state government of protecting Malik. Malik was arrested in connection with a money laundering case linked to gangster Dawood Ibrahim.

89.title: Mumbai to get 'sister city square' to honour bond with 15 sister cities around world
89.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to set up a 'sister city square' at Bandra Kurla Complex in a bid to honour the relationship between Mumbai and its 15 'sister cities' around the world. "The idea is to create a space where domestic and foreign tourists can visit, spend time, and interact with their peers," a civic official said.

90.title: 19-yr-old Srinagar woman injured during grenade attack dies; death toll reaches 2
90.article_body: A 19-year-old woman, who was injured in a grenade attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar, passed away at a hospital on Monday morning. Two persons, including a 79-year-old man, have died because of the blast so far and at least 23 others have sustained injuries. Terrorists had reportedly lobbed a grenade in a busy marketplace near Amira Kadal on Sunday.

91.title: Almost 21,000 people including PM Modi travelled in Pune Metro on Day 1
91.article_body: On its inaugural day, the Pune Metro saw almost 21,000 people taking a ride in it, including Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Currently operating on only two routes, the Garware college-Vanaz station route witnessed 15,842 commuters while the PCMC-Phugewadi station route had 4,616 passengers. Both routes have five stations each and cover a combined distance of 12 km.

92.title: Ashwin's impact has been close to that of Kapil Dev: Gautam Gambhir
92.article_body: Former India opener Gautam Gambhir has said Ravichandran Ashwin's impact as an all-rounder has been "close to that of Kapil Dev". "He has scored five Test hundreds although I don't want to go with stats," added Gambhir. Ashwin scored 61 runs in India's first innings in the first Test against Sri Lanka and also picked six wickets in the match.

93.title: Can state's ₹500, 1000 cure us: Man who pulled cart to UP poll booth
93.article_body: A man reached polling booth in Uttar Pradesh's Azamgarh by pulling cart. His wife who had fracture and handicapped woman were sitting on cart. "I've back problem...and my wife is also not well...[we] used this cart. We've no expectations. Can ₹500, 1000 [given by state] cure us?" he asked. The couple said they did not want to waste their votes.

94.title: Kerala woman alleges tattoo artist raped her after putting needle in her spine
94.article_body: An 18-year-old woman has alleged that tattoo artist Sujeesh PS raped her after putting a needle into her spine in Kerala. She wrote on social media, "I just felt like dying right there on the spot for being so stupid. I felt disgusted." Sujeesh was arrested on Saturday after at least six other women filed sexual assault complaints against him.

95.title: Anti-national activities going on in many private madrassas in Assam: state BJP
95.article_body: The Assam unit of BJP alleged that "anti-national activities" are taking place in many private madrassas in the state. BJP spokespersons Ranjib Kumar Sharma and Mominul Awal made the allegations during a press conference. "It is very shocking that in these private madrassas, the majority of the students are unaware of Mahapurush Sankardeva, Madhabdeva and Lachit Borphukan," the spokespersons said.

96.title: PM Modi speaks to Zelenskyy about evolving situation in Ukraine for 35 minutes: Reports
96.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi spoke to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy about the evolving situation in Ukraine in a phone call that lasted for about 35 minutes, ANI reported. PM Modi appreciated the continuing direct dialogue between Russia and Ukraine, and also thanked Zelenskyy for the help extended by Ukraine in the evacuation of Indian nationals.

97.title: 4 dead as bus runs over labourers working at divider in Telangana
97.article_body: Four labourers died after a bus crashed into a tractor and then ran over them in Telangana's Yadadri Bhuvanagiri on Sunday. The labourers had been working at the road divider and had reportedly taken precautions like placing cones and signboards. The bus driver had been apparently driving at high speed and didn't notice the labourers or the tractor.

98.title: It's 9.5 out of 10 for Rohit Sharma's captaincy in Mohali Test: Gavaskar
98.article_body: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said Rohit Sharma's captaincy in Mohali Test was "absolutely spot on". He added, "[It's] 9.5 out of 10 for Rohit's captaincy in the Test match...The half is what you always keep aside." Gavaskar further said, "When your team was fielding, the bowling changes, the field placement...[it was] very impressive."

99.title: Virat Kohli gifts T-shirt to specially-abled fan at Chandigarh hotel, video goes viral
99.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing former Team India captain Virat Kohli gifting a T-shirt to specially-abled fan Dharamveer Pal outside the team hotel in Chandigarh. Kohli, who played his 100th Test in Mohali, was seen gifting the T-shirt before boarding the bus. Dharamveer is known for attending a lot of Team India matches.

100.title: Man fires at wife, in-laws after fight in Delhi; 3 killed, 1 injured
100.article_body: Three members of a family were killed and one was injured after a man, Hitendra, allegedly fired at his brothers-in-law, sister-in-law and wife after a fight in Delhi on Sunday. The four were taken to the hospital. However, three of them were declared dead. "A case of murder was registered and Hitendra was arrested," police said.

101.title: Punjab body takes action to remove garbage as group takes pic with dump
101.article_body: A Punjab-based civil society group on Sunday organised a 'selfie and photoshoot drive', as a part of which, the group took and posted pictures with garbage. The municipal corporation reportedly dispatched earthmovers to the area to remove garbage within hours. The photoshoot was organised after the group's requests failed to be heard.

102.title: I was going through a phase of loneliness: Jacqueline on mental health
102.article_body: Actress Jacqueline Fernandez appeared as a guest on Shilpa Shetty's upcoming show, 'Shape Of You'. Speaking about mental health in a teaser shared by Shilpa on Instagram, Jacqueline said, "I was...going through a bit of loneliness." Earlier in January this year, Jacqueline shared a statement on Instagram requesting privacy after a photo of her with conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar emerged online.

103.title: TV actress Esha Kansara gets engaged to singer Siddharth Amit Bhavsar
103.article_body: Television actress Esha Kansara got engaged to composer-singer Siddharth Amit Bhavsar on March 4. Esha and Siddharth took to their respective social media handles to share a few pictures from their engagement ceremony. "Look what we did," they captioned the post. Esha was seen in the show 'Zindagi Mere Ghar Aana', where she played the role of Amrita Sakhuja.

104.title: Bihar has sought govt's help to set up chemo units: state Health Minister
104.article_body: Bihar has sought the Centre’s assistance for setting up chemotherapy units in Patna, Gaya, Muzaffarpur, Darbhanga, Purnia and Bhagalpur under the National Health Mission, state Health Minister, Mangal Pandey, said. "The health department has undertaken a door-to-door drive for screening of cancer among people above 30 (years) across the state under the national programme," Pandey added.

105.title: 4-yr-old child tests +ve for polio in Israel in 1st case since 1989
105.article_body: A four-year-old child has tested positive for polio in Israel's Jerusalem in the country's first case since 1989, reported the Jerusalem Post. The country's Health Ministry said that the child hadn't been vaccinated against the virus as part of routine vaccinations in the country. It also added that the regional health administration has opened an epidemiological investigation into the matter.

106.title: Was called 'unlucky' after my first Telugu film: Shruti Haasan
106.article_body: Shruti Haasan revealed that she was called "unlucky" after her first Telugu film. "The common factor between my first two films was the same hero but nobody was ever willing to say that maybe these films didn't work," she added. "And when I did third film, it turned out good. People were like oh she's a golden leg," Shruti said.

107.title: I don't think I can play so much international cricket: Shakib Al Hasan
107.article_body: Bangladesh all-rounder Shakib Al Hasan has suggested pulling out of their upcoming tour of South Africa, stating that he can't play so much international cricket. He added, "Considering my mental and physical state...I don't want to waste the time or someone's spot." Shakib further said that he felt like a passenger in the recently-concluded Afghanistan series.

108.title: I'm recreating Bappi Lahiri and Lata Mangeshkar's songs: Amaal Mallik
108.article_body: Singer Amaal Mallik said that he is recreating a song that was originally of late singer Bappi Lahiri. "I have played my version to him, and only after he approved I took it further. I am also recreating Lata Mangeshkar and Kishore Kumar's 'Kya Yahi Pyar Hai', but I'll do it with due credits to the legendary artists," he said.

109.title: German embassy denies Russian claim of fighting Nazism in Ukraine
109.article_body: German embassy in South Africa has denied its Russian counterpart's claim that the latter is "fighting Nazism in Ukraine", saying, "What Russia is doing in Ukraine is slaughtering innocent children, women and men for its own gain." "Sadly, we're kinda experts on Nazism," it added. Russian embassy had also thanked South Africans for their "letters of solidarity" amid Russia-Ukraine conflict.

110.title: 19-yr-old Delhi woman stabbed to death for rejecting boyfriend's proposal
110.article_body: A man has been arrested in Delhi for allegedly stabbing his 19-year-old girlfriend to death. Police said that the woman's body with three-four stab injuries was found at a vacant ground in Bawana. The accused told police that he and the woman were in a relationship and they got into a fight after she turned down his marriage proposal.

111.title: South Africa's Stephen Mokoka breaks world record in his first-ever 50 km race
111.article_body: South Africa's Stephen Mokoka has broken the world record for men's 50 km race by clocking 2 hours, 40 minutes and 13 seconds at the Nedbank Runified 50 km, a World Athletics Elite Label road race, in Gqeberha. The 37-year-old long-distance runner, featuring in his first-ever 50 km race beat the record set by Ethiopian Ketema Bekele Negasa (2:42:07).

112.title: Dare any one say anything about Varun’s character: Divya after breakup
112.article_body: Actress Divya Agarwal, who announced separation from ex-boyfriend Varun Sood on Sunday, took to Twitter to say, "Dare any one say anything about Varun's character." "Not every separation happens because of character! He is an honest man! It's my decision to be alone no one has the right to speak anything rubbish," she wrote.

113.title: MoS Rajeev Chandrasekhar to attend India Global Forum in Bengaluru
113.article_body: Union Minister of State for Electronics and IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar will attend India Global Forum (IGF) which is being held in Bengaluru on Monday and Tuesday. It's being held in the city for the first time. "India is in midst of a major transformation of and expansion of its economy with PM Narendra Modi's Atmanirbhar Bharat economic roadmap," Chandrasekhar said.

114.title: Russia declares ceasefire in 4 Ukraine cities including Kyiv for evacuations
114.article_body: Russia has declared ceasefire in four Ukrainian cities including capital Kyiv, Mariupol, Kharkov, and Sumy from 10 am Moscow time (12:30 pm IST) for evacuations. The humanitarian corridors are being set up at the personal request of French President Emmanuel Macron, Russia's Defence Ministry said. Notably, hundreds of Indian students are stranded in Sumy.

115.title: UAPA invoked against 10 over Bajrang Dal activist's murder in K'taka
115.article_body: Karnataka Police has invoked sections of Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act, 1967 against 10 persons arrested in connection with the alleged murder of Bajrang Dal activist Harsha. Police said there's suspicion of a larger conspiracy behind the murder. "The accused are local criminals. There are serious doubts that they could've planned and executed the murder on their own," an officer said.

116.title: 3 held in Agra for smuggling marijuana worth ₹95 lakh from Nepal
116.article_body: Three persons have been arrested in Agra, Uttar Pradesh for smuggling marijuana from Nepal, police said on Sunday. "18.980 kg marijuana worth ₹95 lakh, one mobile and four roadways tickets have been recovered from the accused," Agra SP (Protocol), Shiv Ram Yadav, said. "The accused are under interrogation," he added.

117.title: Voting delayed by 40 minutes due to EVM glitch at Varanasi booth: UP minister
117.article_body: Amid the polling for the seventh and final phase of the UP Assembly polls on Monday, state minister Ravindra Jaiswal alleged that the EVM remained switched off at a booth in Maldahiya, Varanasi. "Voting was delayed by around 40 minutes at booth number 311...due to negligence by the polling officer," Jaiswal stated.

118.title: Van allegedly carrying ₹14 lakh gutted in fire in Gurugram, probe on
118.article_body: Van of private bank allegedly carrying ₹14 lakh cash was gutted in fire near IFFCO Chowk flyover in Gurugram on Sunday. Police said even though driver and his co-passenger said they were carrying cash in the van, no money was found from the vehicle. "We suspect...fire broke out due to short circuit in wiring of vehicle...Investigation is underway," Police said.

119.title: People called me mad; wasn't even allowed to cry when I lost my baby: Nisha
119.article_body: In a recent episode of 'Lock Upp', actress Nisha Rawal revealed that she was diagnosed with Bipolar disorder. In a video shared on Nisha's Instagram account, the actress said she was accused of being mentally ill. "[People used to say] she is bipolar, she is crazy...When I lost my baby, I was not even allowed to cry," Nisha said.

120.title: Singer Millind Gaba, Pria Beniwal to tie the knot on April 16: Report
120.article_body: Singer Millind Gaba is set to tie the knot with his longtime girlfriend and social media influencer Pria Beniwal on April 16, reported Hindustan Times. The wedding festivities will begin from April 11, report stated. "All...functions will primarily be in Delhi-NCR...Gaba's friends from industry, including Yo Yo Honey Singh, are also expected to attend it," a source told Hindustan Times.

121.title: Rangnick rejects speculations over Ronaldo's absence from match vs City
121.article_body: Reacting to speculations over Cristiano Ronaldo's absence from the squad for their match against Manchester City due to an injury, United interim manager Ralf Rangnick said, "If players tell the medical department that they are injured and they cannot play I have to accept it." Ex-United captain Roy Keane had said, "Ronaldo is very rarely injured...it doesn't add up."

122.title: Russia recruiting Syrians skilled in urban combat to help take Kyiv: WSJ
122.article_body: Russia is recruiting Syrians skilled in urban combat to help take Ukraine's capital Kyiv, The Wall Street Journal has reported citing US officials. The report said that some fighters are already in Russia preparing to enter the conflict. Further, according to a media outlet in Syria, Russia has offered volunteers from the country between $200 and $300 for six months.

123.title: 2 men take inappropriate pics of woman as she feeds toddler in Pune
123.article_body: Two men were booked after they allegedly took inappropriate pictures of a woman while she was feeding her toddler in Pune. The accused did so while sitting in a car parked in front of the complainant. One of the accused also apparently attempted to attack the woman's husband, who'd confronted the duo when they started sniggering, with a pavement block.

124.title: It was great fun: Rakul Preet on playing condom-tester in 'Chhatriwali'
124.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh said that she had "great fun" shooting for her upcoming film 'Chhatriwali'. "We are not showing anything sleazy. There is not one kiss in the film. It's a journey of a small-town girl and it's in humour. She stumbles upon this job, she also looks down upon it [initially]," she added.

125.title: Protesting BJP men climb atop Delhi minister Satyendar Jain's car
125.article_body: Delhi BJP workers stopped and climbed atop Health Minister Satyendar Jain's vehicle in protest against the new liquor policy on Sunday. The incident happened near Goyala Vihar in Chhawla where Jain had gone to inaugurate sewer development work. Additional DCP (Dwarka) Vikram Singh said that the protestors were removed immediately.

126.title: Pakistani drone carrying contraband shot down by BSF along border in Punjab
126.article_body: A Pakistani quadcopter was shot down by Border Security Force (BSF) troops along the international border in Punjab's Ferozepur sector on Monday morning, an official said. According to a BSF spokesperson, five packets containing contraband items were seized from a green bag, which was found attached to the drone. The gross weight of the suspected contraband is over 4 kilograms.

127.title: 2 arrested for running sex determination racket in Rajkot
127.article_body: The Rajkot Crime Branch arrested a male nurse from Una in Gir Somnath and a woman from Rajkot city after they were caught conducting a sex determination procedure with the help of an unregistered medical ultrasound device. The accused were conducting illegal sex determination tests of foetuses and were providing the facility for illegal abortions.

128.title: Ukraine shares map of roads controlled by Russian troops
128.article_body: Ukraine's Centre for Strategic Communications and Information Security took to Twitter to share a map showing areas controlled by Russian troops after 11th day of the ongoing war. It wrote, "Important: Russians do not control territories in the north, east, and south, they only control roads marked in red, facing fierce opposition from local Ukrainian citizens."

129.title: Late penalty helps Barcelona defeat Elche 2-1 in La Liga
129.article_body: Barcelona won their La Liga match against Elche 2-1 after forward Memphis Depay scored a penalty in the final minutes of the game on Sunday. Barcelona were trailing 0-1 at halftime before Ferran Torres scored an equaliser in the 61st minute. With 13 wins out of 26, Barcelona are now at the third spot on the points table.

130.title: Hrithik calls rumoured girlfriend Saba 'extraordinary' as she sings Bangla song
130.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan reacted to rumoured girlfriend Saba Azad's video in which she's seen singing a Bangla song. Sharing the video on Instagram, Saba wrote, "Sick at home with no energy to do much else than sing, when I was...small my parents got me the cassette...of the classic Ray film." Reacting to her video, Hrithik commented, "You're an extraordinary human."

131.title: Are we your slaves?: Pak PM Imran on West's push to condemn Russia
131.article_body: After 22 Western countries' envoys wrote a joint letter urging Pakistan to condemn Russia's invasion of Ukraine, the country's PM Imran Khan reacted to it saying, "What do you think of us? Are we your slaves that whatever you say, we will do?" He also questioned the European Union ambassadors as to if they'd written such a letter to India.

132.title: Revamping places of worship is also development: Anurag Thakur
132.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Sunday said that revamping the places of worship is also a part of development. "The face of Kashi has changed in the last couple of years and the crowds at BJP's roadshows are testimonies of their faith in the party," Thakur added. "We did work on the promises we made," Thakur stated.

133.title: Delhi ragpicker killed by acquaintances over inability to return ₹500
133.article_body: A 45-year-old ragpicker was allegedly killed by two of his acquaintances for his inability to return ₹500 that he had borrowed from one of them in Delhi. The two accused were arrested on Sunday. Police said that they had found the victim lying dead with his throat slit and an injury on his forehead.

134.title: MBBS students seen walking in line with tonsured heads in U'khand; probe ordered
134.article_body: Several first-year MBBS students wearing lab coats, with their heads tonsured and hands behind their backs, were purportedly seen walking with their heads down in a line around Uttarakhand's Government Medical College, Haldwani campus in a video that surfaced online. Following the incident, the college administration has called for an inquiry to probe if ragging had taken place.

135.title: Had a big argument with her: Shweta on Navya's 'guests coming over' remark
135.article_body: Shweta Bachchan revealed that she and her son Agastya had a "big argument" with her daughter Navya over a comment she made about their family dynamics in an interview. "We said, 'how could you say this? This isn't how our house works'," she added. "If we've guests over...I've to play...host as opposed to...my brother," Navya was earlier quoted as saying.

136.title: 852 Tamil Nadu students from Ukraine reached state: Govt
136.article_body: Of the 1,011 Tamil Nadu students who have arrived in Delhi from Ukraine so far, 852 of them have reached the state and arrangements are on to bring the remaining 159, the government said on Sunday. The 852 students include 180 who were brought to Chennai from Delhi on Sunday by a special flight chartered by the state government.

137.title: Cricketers didn't like that there was a woman wearing saree and talking cricket: Mandira
137.article_body: Recalling the days when she used to host pre-match shows at cricket tournaments, actress Mandira Bedi said, "Nobody accepted me...certainly not the people sitting on the panel." She added, "I'm friends with all...ex-cricketers now who I worked with back then...but they didn’t like that either. They didn’t like that there was a woman wearing a saree, dressed up, talking cricket."

138.title: Anupam Kher shares pics of his physical transformation on his 67th birthday
138.article_body: Actor Anupam Kher took to Twitter to share pictures of his physical transformation on the occasion of his 67th birthday. "I have always believed in reinventing myself. Today as I start my 67th year, I am motivated to share these pics with you. I know I have miles to go," he wrote, adding that he wants to inspire people.

139.title: India's daily COVID-19 cases drop below 5,000-mark, 66 deaths reported in 24 hours
139.article_body: India has reported 4,362 new COVID-19 cases and 66 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Out of the 66 deaths, 51 deaths occurred during the day in the country while 15 were reconciled deaths in Kerala. The daily positivity rate stood at 0.71% and the active cases stood at 54,118.

140.title: Sensex plunges over 1,600 points, drops below 53,000 for 1st time in 7 months
140.article_body: Sensex plunged over 1,600 points to trade at over 52,600, while Nifty was down over 400 points at over 15,820 in the opening session on Monday as Russia-Ukraine war entered its 12th day. This is the first time in over seven months that Sensex dropped below 53,000. Tata Steel is the only gainer on Sensex today so far.

141.title: I think a lot of players are comfortable with Rohit's captaincy: Jaffer
141.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer said Rohit Sharma is looking comfortable captaining India across formats. He added, "Lot of players are [also] looking comfortable with his captaincy. Rohit gives them a lot of freedom. He got his field placing and bowling changes spot on." Jaffer further said, "You can see the smiling faces in Indian camp and that's nice to see."

142.title: Suspension of special operation only possible if Ukraine stops military operations: Putin
142.article_body: In a phone call with Turkish President Tayyip Erdogan, Russian President Vladimir Putin said that the suspension of its "special operation" is only possible if Ukraine stops its military operations and carries out well-known Russian demands, according to the Kremlin. Putin added that his "special operation" in Ukraine was going according to plan and to schedule.

143.title: A casting director told me 'you're good, but you've a generic face': Rakul
143.article_body: Rakul Preet Singh revealed that before her debut, she went to an audition where a casting director told her, "You're very good but the only problem I feel is, you've a generic face." "I said 'that's what it is, I can't help it'," she added. When asked if she ever questioned herself about that, Rakul said, "No, I questioned them."

144.title: Punjab man returning home with friend killed as fuel tanker crushes him
144.article_body: A 32-year-old man, Sartaj Singh, was crushed under a fuel tanker in Punjab's Kharar on Saturday. The man was returning home with his friend, Anil Kumar, when a Bharat Petroleum tanker hit his bike. Sartaj was crushed under the wheels of the tanker and was rushed to the hospital. He was declared brought dead. Case was registered against tanker driver.

145.title: Ahan and I had to do The Dirty Picture scene for Tadap chemistry read: Tara
145.article_body: Actress Tara Sutaria, who starred in 'Tadap' alongside actor Ahan Shetty, said for the chemistry reading, they had to act and recite 'The Dirty Picture' scene and dialogues. She added, "I was handed a printout of a scene from 'The Dirty Picture'...[Director]...asked me to read through it with Ahan and we casually acted it." "It felt completely right," Tara said.

146.title: Was doing people favours instead of choosing the right scripts: Preeti
146.article_body: Actress Preeti Jhangiani, while talking about her career, said she did people favours instead of choosing the right scripts for her career. "Let's just put it to not having enough experience in choosing right scripts or not having somebody to help me chart out my career plan as I should have. Today I would be a little hard-hearted," she said.

147.title: Special flight carrying 160 Indian students evacuated from Ukraine reaches Delhi
147.article_body: A special flight, carrying 160 Indian evacuees from Ukraine, landed in New Delhi on Monday from Budapest in Hungary. The Air Asia flight evacuated the stranded students and landed at the airport at around 4:00-4:30 am. "After we crossed the Ukraine border, the Indian Embassy provided all the facilities," Gowardhan, a student said.

148.title: 24,302 mangroves to be felled for Virar-Dahanu railway line expansion in Palghar
148.article_body: The Mumbai Railway Vikas Corporation will divert 26.5 hectares of forest land across 11 villages in Palghar to expand the existing railway line between Virar and Dahanu stations. As per official documents, the project will lead to the felling of 25,438 trees, including 24,302 mangroves. Compensatory afforestation has been proposed on 54 hectares of degraded land in three nearby villages.

149.title: Javed Akhtar watched 'The Fame...' asked me 'when is season 2 coming': Madhuri
149.article_body: Madhuri Dixit revealed lyricist Javed Akhtar called her up "out of the blue" and asked about season two of 'The Fame Game'. Madhuri said, "He binged watched it. He said, 'Bhai batao season 2 kab araha hai (Tell me when is season two coming out)'." "He said he loved it and I was so glad," she added.

150.title: 4 including 2 foreign nationals arrested for MDMA sale in Bengaluru
150.article_body: Four people, including two foreign nationals, have been arrested by the police in Bengaluru for the alleged possession and sale of MDMA, the city's DCP (North East Division) Anoop A Shetty said on Sunday. Police also reportedly seized 105 gm of MDMA worth about ₹2.8 lakh from them. The arrests were made after police received a tip-off, according to reports.

151.title: Kevin De Bruyne, Riyad Mahrez score 2 each as Man City beat Man United 4-1
151.article_body: Kevin De Bruyne and Riyad Mahrez both scored twice as Manchester City beat Manchester United 4-1 in the Premier League. With the win, City restored their gap at the top of the standings to six points over Liverpool, who have a game in hand. United, who were playing without Cristiano Ronaldo, are now placed fifth in the points table.

152.title: Top 4 IT firms to hire 1.4 lakh freshers for FY23: Report
152.article_body: Cognizant, HCL Tech, Wipro, and Tech Mahindra will together hire 1,40,000 freshers for the coming year, as per Moneycontrol. To meet this growing demand, NIIT stated that it is training graduates through its new-age online courses by imparting 360⁰ technical competencies and workplace soft skills with an assured placement at ₹10 LPA* upon course completion.

153.title: The film got made but it never came out: Kirti on being offered film at 17
153.article_body: Actress Kirti Kulhari was reportedly offered a film at the age of 17. Reports said that it was a Sushant Misra movie. "The film got made but it never came out. I wanted to give acting a proper try...There was calling from within...I finished my post graduation and asked parents to give me two years to pursue acting," she added.

154.title: Footwear thrown at Fadnavis' car in Pimpri-Chinchwad during visit
154.article_body: Footwear was thrown at the car of former Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis in Pimpri-Chinchwad, where he was visiting to inaugurate a developmental work on Sunday. The incident took place as NCP and BJP workers clashed with each other while Fadnavis arrived for the event. A police official said that mild lathi-charge was used to bring the situation under control.

155.title: 986 dark, dimly-lit areas and spots with poor phone network in Delhi: Audit data
155.article_body: There are 986 dark and dimly-lit areas and spots with poor phone network in Delhi, as per an audit conducted by Delhi Police. Police Commissioner Rakesh Asthana asked all DCPs about their efforts to improve the situation. Police said network issues often act as a hindrance for users of women's safety mobile app 'Tatpar', when they try to share details.

156.title: Scum shelling our cities will not have a quiet place on Earth except a grave: Zelenskyy
156.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said Russia's audacity is a clear signal for the West that the imposed sanctions aren't enough. He said, "We'll punish everyone who committed atrocities in this war. We'll find every scum who was shelling our cities, our people...who was giving orders. You'll not have a quiet place on this Earth – except for a grave."

157.title: B'luru Police clean sign boards for motorists' visibility, share pics
157.article_body: Bengaluru Traffic Police on Sunday took to Twitter to share pictures of signal lights, blinkers and sign boards being cleaned in various parts of the city. The sign boards and traffic notification panels were cleaned for them to be visible to motorists in the city. The pictures were shared from Adugodi, KG Halli and Pulakeshi areas.

158.title: Ukraine's Foreign Minister shares pic of 500-kg Russian bomb that failed to explode
158.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba has claimed that a 500-kg Russian bomb fell on a residential building in Chernihiv and didn't explode. Sharing a picture of the bomb, he wrote, "Many other did, killing innocent men, women and children. Help us protect our people from Russian barbarians! Help us close the sky. Provide us with combat aircraft. Do something!"

159.title: India's envoy to Palestine Mukul Arya found dead inside embassy
159.article_body: India's envoy to Palestine Mukul Arya was found dead inside the embassy in Ramallah on Sunday. "Deeply shocked to learn about the passing away of India’s Representative at Ramallah, Shri Mukul Arya. He was a bright and talented officer with so much before him," External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar tweeted. The cause of his death is not yet known.

160.title: Voting underway for 54 seats in final phase of UP Assembly elections
160.article_body: Voting for the seventh and final phase of Uttar Pradesh Assembly elections began at 7 am on Monday. Overall 613 candidates across 54 seats in nine districts, including PM Narendra Modi's parliamentary constituency Varanasi, are in fray. "I request all voters to participate in the...last phase of elections with full enthusiasm and create a new voting record," PM Modi tweeted.

161.title: 'Gender Equality Run' organised in Hyderabad, pics surface
161.article_body: Hyderabad Police took to Twitter to share pictures from the 'Gender Equality Run' that was organised at People's Plaza Necklace Road in the city on Sunday. "Pleasant Sunday morning...thousands of Hyderabadis gathered at People's Plaza Necklace Road at 5:30 AM [to] participate in the Gender Equality Run organised by SHE teams...to mark upcoming women's day on March 8th," Police wrote.

162.title: Hyderabad Police urge people to give info on narcotics, share number
162.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Sunday took to Twitter to share a post about drug awareness. "Addiction not only kills the addict but also kills the family!! We urge the citizens to share any type of information of marijuana, ganja & other narcotics through WhatsApp or SMS to 9490617111. Your identity will be kept confidential," police wrote.

163.title: McDonald's sued for $900 million by US startup over false advertising claims
163.article_body: US-based Kytch, which sells devices to fix broken ice cream machines, has sued McDonald's for $900 million alleging false advertising and tortious interference with its business. As per Kytch, McDonald's told its franchisees that the startup's devices violated their machines' warranties and could lead to "serious human injury". Kytch denied both the claims and accused McDonald's of defamation.

164.title: Mumbai man jailed for taking shirt off before policewomen
164.article_body: A 38-year-old Mumbai man was jailed for 10 days for removing his shirt and making an indecent gesture in front of women officers in a fit of anger at a police station. Ganesh Kharwa was convicted along with Babu Kharwa, a man he was publically fighting with in 2016. The other man was also handed a 10-day sentence.

165.title: Woman loses ₹5 lakh in KYC fraud, breaks phone to prevent more loss
165.article_body: A 56-year-old woman from Mumbai's Mira Road lost ₹5 lakh after getting a call from a person claiming to update her KYC. The caller gained remote access of the victim's phone after making her download an application. Being unable to switch off her phone after realising she was being duped, the victim broke it to prevent further loss.

166.title: Poor are BJP's wealth, will give us over 300 seats in UP: Minister
166.article_body: Ahead of the last phase of Uttar Pradesh elections, Union Minister Mahendra Nath Pandey on Sunday said the poor are BJP's "wealth" and will take it beyond the 300-seat mark. "Mulayam Singh Yadav is...saying the BJP has not done anything for the poor. There will be no impact of such statements," Pandey added.

167.title: BJP blames TMC's terror, police harassment for WB civic poll rout
167.article_body: The West Bengal BJP on Saturday alleged "terror" perpetrated by ruling Trinamool Congress (TMC) and harassment of its workers by police are reasons for its poor performance in the civic body polls. The claims were made at an organisational meeting of the party in Kolkata. "The state police was...acting as an extension of the ruling party," a BJP leader said.

168.title: J&K Police bust Jaish-e-Mohammad module in Awantipora, arrest 4
168.article_body: J&K Police on Sunday said the force arrested four terror associates after busting a terror module of banned terrorist organisation Jaish-e-Mohammad in Awantipora. Preliminary investigation revealed they were providing shelter, logistical support, transportation and arms/ammunition to terrorists. The associates were identified as Umar Dar, Soraj Malik, Irshad Ahmad Lone and Afnan Javeed Khan.

169.title: 5 men arrested with 7 stolen bikes in Indore, keys & tools recovered
169.article_body: Five men were arrested by the Crime Branch on Saturday after they stole seven bikes in Madhya Pradesh's Indore. The arrests were made after police received information that some men were seen planning a theft in the Palasia area. The police seized the stolen bikes from their possession and also recovered some keys and other tools.

170.title: Govt official killed, 2 hurt after car hits tree in Maha's Beed
170.article_body: A government official has died and two others have been injured after their car rammed into a tree in Maharashtra's Beed district. Police said the incident happened in Rakshasbhuvan Road in Georai taluka at around 2 am on Sunday. The deceased was identified as Nitin Jadhav, a Mandal officer in Beed, who was returning to district headquarters with other personnel.

171.title: Security forces arrest active LeT terrorist in J&K's Ganderbal
171.article_body: Security forces on Sunday arrested an active terrorist of Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) from Jammu and Kashmir's Ganderbal district. Upon seeing an intensive security check, the terrorist tried to escape but was challenged and later caught, the police said. The terrorist has been identified as Mohammad Altaf Wani, a resident of Shopian's Keegam village.

172.title: 1,234 Haryana students evacuated from Ukraine: CM Khattar
172.article_body: Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar on Sunday said around 1,800 students from the state were stuck in Ukraine, of which 1,234 have been evacuated so far. He further said that 80 students are still stuck in Ukraine, while others have reached the country's borders. The CM added that students who have completed their course will be given internship opportunities.

173.title: Tripura to convert jail to library, name it after ex-B'desh PM
173.article_body: The Tripura government is planning to convert the old Central Jail compound into a library named after Bangladesh's father of the nation Sheikh Mujibur Rahman. The former Bangladesh PM had, according to historians, spent a night at the complex during Bangladesh's liberation war before meeting the then Tripura CM. However, no official records of the meeting were kept.

174.title: Citizens stuck in Ukraine as Centre was asleep: Congress leader
174.article_body: Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole on Sunday said that Indian citizens remain stranded in Ukraine "because the Central government was asleep". "PM Narendra Modi is a campaigner. He remained busy in campaigning. The foreign policy of the government has failed," Patole added. Eight flights, five from Hungary and three from Romania, are expected to bring back over 1,500 Indians tomorrow.

175.title: K'taka CM inaugurates regional forensic science lab in Hubballi
175.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Sunday inaugurated a regional forensic science laboratory in Hubballi.
