350.title: US teacher charged for slapping student, faces up to 2.5yrs in jail
350.article_body: A 61-year-old teacher in US' Indiana has been charged with battery and faces up to 2.5 years in jail after he allegedly slapped a student across the face. The teacher was recently granted immediate retirement following the incident. A video of the incident purportedly shows the accused grabbing the student's backpack, forcing him into a wall and slapping him.

351.title: 2 Dalit children beaten up for touching utensil containing water in MP; 8 booked
351.article_body: A Dalit family was allegedly beaten up by members of the Lodhi community in a village in Madhya Pradesh's Damoh after two children belonging to the family touched a utensil filled with water, police said. Eight people have been booked in this connection. Five of the family members, including the children, sustained injuries and are undergoing treatment at a hospital.

352.title: Pics show PM Narendra Modi buying ticket before his Pune Metro ride
352.article_body: PM Narendra Modi took a ride on the Pune Metro after inaugurating a 12-km stretch of the metro rail project on Sunday. A picture shared by the Prime Minister's Office shows PM Modi buying a ticket at the ticket counter before taking a ride from Garware College to Anand Nagar. PM Modi also interacted with school students on the train.

353.title: Billionaire Thiel's Founders Fund raises $5 billion in 2 new funds
353.article_body: Billionaire Peter Thiel co-founded Founders Fund has raised $5 billion across two new funds, bringing its total assets under management to roughly $11 billion. The venture capital firm's new vehicles include a $1.9 billion early-stage fund and a $3.4 billion growth-stage fund. Founded in 2005, Founders Fund has invested in several major startups including Meta, SpaceX, Airbnb and Palantir.

354.title: Ukrainian soldiers marry each other amid war without parents, friends; pic surfaces
354.article_body: Two soldiers belonging to the National Guard of Ukraine got married in the Rivne region amid the Russia-Ukraine war. The National Guard of Ukraine's Twitter handle shared their picture and tweeted that the couple married "without a white dress, friends, parents, but with a delicate bouquet of the bride". It added, "They swore, hugged, and went on to defend Ukraine!"

355.title: Pic of Pakistani fan's poster on Australia's Labuschagne goes viral
355.article_body: A picture of a Pakistani fan holding a poster on Australia's Marnus Labsuchagne during the first Pakistan-Australia Test in Rawalpindi has gone viral on social media. "Beware of Marnus...He will say 'No Run' all day and end up with a 100," the poster read. Labsuchagne is known for shouting 'No Run' at times while batting.

356.title: Jadeja's old interview goes viral after he scores ton, takes 5-wicket haul in same Test
356.article_body: India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja's interview from 2018 went viral after he slammed 175*(228) and took a five-wicket haul against Sri Lanka in the first Test in Mohali. In the interview, Jadeja was asked what cricketing record he would like to have at the end of his career. Jadeja had responded, "A hundred and a five wicket-haul in the same match."

357.title: 300-yr-old mummy of a mermaid-like creature to be studied by Japanese scientists
357.article_body: A group of scientists from Japan's Kurashiki University of Science and the Arts will study a nearly 300-year-old mummy that's in the shape of a 'mermaid'. The mysterious 12-inch creature was allegedly caught in the Pacific Ocean between 1736, 1741. Pictures of the creature show it has pointed teeth and its lower half has scales and a tail-like tapered end.

358.title: Plan was to get to 200: Pooja Vastrakar who helped India score 244/7 vs Pak
358.article_body: India Women all-rounder Pooja Vastrakar, who scored 67 off 59 balls in their ICC Women's ODI World Cup match against Pakistan, has said the plan was to get to 200 as she was told the wicket was slow. Vastrakar came in to bat when India were 114/6 and added 122 runs with Sneh Rana to help India post 244/7.

359.title: Illegal open bar operating in Gurugram shut down after raid
359.article_body: An open bar operating illegally in Gurugram was shut down following a joint raid by the CM’s flying squad and the Excise Department, the police said. The cashier of the establishment was arrested during the raid that was conducted on Saturday night, they added. Over 90 people were found drinking liquor and smoking hookah at the bar during the raid.

360.title: GST Council may raise lowest tax slab from 5% to 8%: Reports
360.article_body: The GST Council may, in its next meeting, raise the lowest tax slab from 5% to 8% and prune the GST exemption list to increase revenues, Moneycontrol reported. A state finance ministers' panel will submit its report by March-end to the Council. The panel may also recommend a three-tier GST structure, with rates at 8%, 18% and 28%.

361.title: Pak cricket captain Bismah Maroof arrives for match with baby in arms, pic viral
361.article_body: A picture of Pakistan’s women's cricket team captain Bismah Maroof is being widely shared on social media after she arrived at the stadium in New Zealand holding her six-month-old baby girl. ICC also shared Maroof's picture. India defeated Pakistan in their first match of the 2022 Women's World Cup in New Zealand on Sunday.

362.title: I'm grateful to Musk for supporting Ukraine in words and deeds: Zelenskyy
362.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy took to Twitter to share details of the conversation he had with the world's richest man Elon Musk, and tweeted, "I am grateful to him for supporting Ukraine with words and deeds." He informed that next week, Ukraine will receive another batch of Starlink systems for destroyed cities. "Possible space projects were discussed," Zelenskyy added.

363.title: Centre indifferent to Indians in Ukraine: Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury
363.article_body: Congress' Lok Sabha leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury has criticised the Centre for allegedly displaying "all kinds of apathy and indifference towards Indians" stranded in the war-hit Ukraine. "The (central) government was busy in campaigning for the elections when evacuation [activities] should have been given the top priority," added Chowdhury. He also accused PM Modi of "misleading" Indians.

364.title: UP CM Yogi interacts with Ukraine-returned students in Lucknow
364.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath interacted with students who have returned to India from Ukraine in Lucknow, on Sunday. "Thirty-three new medical colleges and two new AIIMS hospitals have been established in the state. In the next one year, there will be a medical college in every district of the state," CM Yogi added while interacting with the students.

365.title: India begins last leg of evacuation from Ukraine, asks students to reach Budapest
365.article_body: The Indian Embassy in Hungary on Sunday tweeted that India is beginning its last leg of Operation Ganga flights today. "All those students staying in their own accommodation (other than arranged by Embassy) are requested to reach Hungaria city centre, Rakoczi Ut 90, Budapest between 10 am-12 pm," said the Embassy.

366.title: Indian student in Ukraine skips 4 flights, gives up luggage for her pet dog
366.article_body: A medical student in Ukraine skipped four special flights until Indian embassy allowed her to fly with her pet dog. Keerthana reached Chennai airport along with her dog 'Candy' on Saturday. She said, "I waited for extra two-three days. Authorities said I can bring my puppy but I will have to let go of my luggage. I said okay."

367.title: FPIs withdraw record ₹17,537 crore between March 2-4
367.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) withdrew net ₹17,537 crore between March 2-4 amid the Russia-Ukraine crisis. This is almost half of the amount FPIs withdrew in February 2022 at ₹35,506 crore, which was the highest amount withdrawn since March 2020. As per depositories data, they pulled out ₹14,721 crore from equities and ₹2,808 crore from the debt segment.

368.title: It was mentally exhausting to play pregnant cop in 'A Thursday': Neha
368.article_body: Actress Neha Dhupia said it was physically and mentally exhausting for her to play a pregnant cop in 'A Thursday' under extreme weather conditions. She added the biggest challenge was imposed because of COVID-19 as she was shooting the movie during the pandemic. Neha further said that she believes there is no harm in working while a woman is expecting.

369.title: 3 killed, 36 injured as bus carrying labourers overturns in MP
369.article_body: Three people, including a 12-year-old girl, were killed and 36 others injured after a bus carrying labourers overturned in Madhya Pradesh's Shahdol district on Saturday night. The private bus was going to Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow from Kawardha in Chhattisgarh. Eight of the injured people were discharged after treatment at a nearby health centre.

370.title: Himachal gets its 1st-ever multipurpose rainwater harvesting dam
370.article_body: Himachal Pradesh has got its first-ever multipurpose rainwater harvesting dam constructed in Una at a cost of ₹16.38 crore. State Rural Development Minister Virender Kanwar said that the dam will help 5,580 citizens living in water-deficient areas through the dry season. The dam will also help recharge around 44 hand pumps and 31 wells that dry up during drought season.

371.title: Burkina Faso forms interim government after military coup in January
371.article_body: Burkina Faso's transitional President Lieutenant-Colonel Paul-Henri Damiba has appointed a new government after a military coup in January this year, according to official decree. The government includes 25 ministers, including Defence Minister General Barthelemy Simpore, who had held same position under previous administration. Burkina Faso's military coup was fourth in West Africa in 18 months.

372.title: OTT lets me work with actors who are hungry, not stars: Tigmanshu
372.article_body: Filmmaker Tigmanshu Dhulia has said that he enjoys working on OTT platforms because he gets to work with actors who are hungry and not stars. The filmmaker further said that the footprint for OTT content is larger which is the fun part. "Earlier only people in our country...[watched] our work...But now somebody in Africa is seeing my work," Tigmanshu added.

373.title: Men should not look pretty, men should look imperfect: John Abraham
373.article_body: Actor John Abraham in an interview has stated that he believes men should not look pretty, adding that men should look imperfect. The actor further said that fitness is a tripod consisting of good food, good exercise and good sleep. A social media user reacted to John's statement, commenting, "John's statements are problematic but no one says anything to him."

374.title: Working women must choose very carefully when to become mother: Kiran
374.article_body: Former IPS officer Kiran Bedi said working women should "very carefully" choose when to become a mother. "You should not marry unless you are economically independent, or unless someone chooses to be homemaker...it is not imposed decision," she said, adding, "My mother ensured I came back home to warm food, warm bed...clean home...children are taken care of while I worked."

375.title: PM Modi inaugurates 100 new electric buses in Pune
375.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday inaugurated 100 new electric buses at the Baner depot in Pune. Now, the city has 250 electric buses by Olectra. Another 50 buses are ready to join the fleet by March-end. Earlier in the day, PM Modi also inaugurated the Pune metro rail project and took a ride on a metro train.

376.title: Drone carries blood samples from UP’s Meerut to Noida within 1 hour
376.article_body: A private diagnostic lab in Noida used a drone to transport blood samples from Uttar Pradesh's Meerut to Noida within just one hour. The journey would have taken around 2-3 hours by road, as per reports. The drone belonging to Skye Air Mobility carried blood samples inside a temperature-controlled box and covered a distance of 73.6 km.

377.title: What's a no-fly zone & why was Ukraine's demand for it rejected by NATO?
377.article_body: Declaring a no-fly zone over Ukraine, as per the country's demand, would bar all unauthorised aircraft from flying over it. Western nations imposed such restrictions following the 1991 Gulf War, civil war in Bosnia and Herzegovina etc. NATO rejected Ukraine's demand because it would risk a direct military conflict with Russia by forcing NATO pilots to shoot down Russian aircraft.

378.title: That was a thrashing and in a grand style: Sehwag as India beat Pakistan in Women's WC
378.article_body: Reacting to India defeating Pakistan by 107 runs in their 2022 Women's World Cup opener, Virender Sehwag tweeted, "What a spectacular performance by the Indian girls against Pakistan. That was a thrashing and in grand style." He added, "Pooja Vastrakar with a valiant innings, the ever so reliable Sneh Rana's great all-round show & Rajeshwari Gayakwad outstanding with the ball."

379.title: Happy we won against Pak, but there are a lot of things to work on: Mithali
379.article_body: After defeating Pakistan by 107 runs, India Women captain Mithali Raj said she's happy to have won in their Women's ODI WC opener but there are a lot of things they need to work on. "When you lose wickets in the middle order, it puts a lot of pressure," she added. At one point, India were 114/6  in the match.

380.title: Man driving recklessly stopped & hurled abuses in road rage, claims Kemmu; shares pic
380.article_body: Actor Kunal Kemmu took to his Instagram Stories to urge Mumbai Police to take action against a driver who Kemmu claimed was driving recklessly. Kemmu said that the driver stopped in front of his car, got out, showed middle finger and hurled abuses. Kemmu called the driver's behaviour "obnoxious and pathetic".

381.title: Sonakshi skipped event after taking ₹37 lakh, non-bailable warrant issued: Reports
381.article_body: A non-bailable warrant has been issued against Sonakshi Sinha in a 2019 fraud case regarding the actress not attending an event in Delhi after allegedly taking ₹37 lakh in advance, reports said. According to event organiser Pramod Sharma, from UP's Moradabad, Sinha's manager refused to return the money. Moradabad court has reportedly issued a non-bailable warrant against the actress.

382.title: People are educated in Kerala, won't let us make bad films: Aashiq Abu
382.article_body: Filmmaker Aashiq Abu said that the audience of Kerala won't let filmmakers make bad films. "Every industry has good films and bad films, but in Kerala, people are educated...have access to world cinema. The audiences are very critical and strict there...We can't afford to make a mediocre film...year by year, writers and directors are pushing their limits," he added.

383.title: Zelenskyy invites world's richest man Elon Musk to visit Ukraine; shares video
383.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on a video call with Elon Musk invited the world's richest man to visit Ukraine. "So, If you have time after the war, you are very welcome, I invite you," Zelenskyy told Musk. In a video clip shared by Zelenskyy on Instagram, Musk responded, "That sound's good, I look forward to visiting once things are..."

384.title: Ashwin overtakes Kapil Dev to become India's second-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket
384.article_body: Ravichandran Ashwin has become India's second-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket. The 35-year-old off-spinner achieved the feat after taking his 435th wicket in Test cricket by dismissing Sri Lanka's Charith Asalanka in their second innings in the first Test in Mohali. Ashwin overtook former India captain Kapil Dev, who had taken 434 wickets in Test cricket.

385.title: Unarmed Ukrainians shout 'go home' as they march towards Russian soldiers
385.article_body: A video has surfaced on social media that showed unarmed civilians marching towards a group of armed Russian soldiers in a street in Ukraine's Melitopol. In the clip, the soldiers can be seen firing in order to disperse the approaching crowd. The locals can also be heard shouting at the soldiers and asking them to "go home".

386.title: Heartbreaking to see places where we shot being bombed: Vishwesh on Ukraine
386.article_body: Filmmaker Vishwesh Krishnamoorthy, who spent time in Ukraine while working on his film '99 Songs', said that it is heartbreaking to see places where they filmed being bombed or destroyed. "I have...friends in Ukraine who were part of crew...It is difficult to read updates from my friends...can't imagine that we are in 2022 and war is real thing," he added.

387.title: Russian hackers are attacking our websites nonstop, says Ukraine
387.article_body: Russian hackers have been attacking Ukrainian websites, including that of the President and the defence ministry, "nonstop" since Russia launched an invasion of the country, Ukraine's cyber watchdog agency said. "The most powerful attacks exceeded 100 Gbps at their peak. Despite all the involved enemy's resources, the sites of...central governmental bodies are available," it added.

388.title: PM Modi inaugurates Pune Metro, pics show him interacting with school students on train
388.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday inaugurated Pune Metro Rail Project. A tweet from the Prime Minister's Twitter account showed pictures of him interacting with school students on train. It read, "On board the Pune Metro with my young friends." The inaugural event for the 12-km stretch of the total 32.2-km long project took place at the Garware Metro Station.

389.title: Karamyogi of country: Amit Shah on CISF's 53rd Raising Day ceremony
389.article_body: Union Minister Amit Shah thanked the Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) for being the 'Karamyogi' of the country. "During COVID-19 pandemic when Indians were coming back from abroad, CISF personnel took risks in taking care of fellow Indians and even lost their lives," Shah added. He attended the 53rd Raising Day celebrations of CISF at Indirapuram, Ghaziabad.

390.title: Drunk man kills colleague after fight over repayment of ₹100 loan in Mumbai
390.article_body: A 35-year-old man was bludgeoned to death with a cement block allegedly by his colleague in Mumbai over repayment of ₹100, police said. According to police, the victim, who used to do odd jobs in the locality, had borrowed ₹100 from the accused. "The two were in an inebriated state and had a fight over the loan," an officer said.

391.title: France accused UK of 'lack of humanity' for Ukrainian refugees: AFP
391.article_body: French Interior Minister Gérald Darmanin in a letter to UK Home Secretary Priti Patel said that the latter's country's response "lacked humanity" towards Ukrainian refugees, reported AFP. He added that 150 Ukrainian refugees who wanted to join their families in UK were turned away at France's Calais. He also urged the UK to set up a consular presence in Calais.

392.title: Delhi Jal Board to lay 575 km of sewage lines, aims to clean Yamuna
392.article_body: The Delhi Jal Board has approved the laying of 575km long sewage lines in unauthorised colonies along with three other projects. DJB chairperson Satyendar Jain said that these lines will carry wastewater from several areas including Sangam Vihar and Sarangpur. The projects, including the installation of an interceptor sewer line at the Barapullah drain, are aimed at cleaning the Yamuna.

393.title: British intelligence services used Grindr to track Russian soldiers: Reports
393.article_body: British intelligence services reportedly monitored the Russian invasion of Ukraine by tracking the soldiers’ use of apps like the gay dating app Grindr and VKontakte, the Russian equivalent for Facebook. The intelligence services gave the information to Ukraine to help them amid the conflict.  Russian President Vladimir Putin had banned Grindr in 2013, but the app is still used discreetly.

394.title: One can stay away from it by focusing on goal: Ajay on dealing with negativity
394.article_body: Ajay Devgn opened up about how he deals with negativity coming his way and said, "You can't change the way people think. It is their prerogative." "One can stay away from negativity by focusing on the goal," he added. Ajay was recently seen in the film 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' and the web show 'Rudra: The Edge of Darkness'.

395.title: Mandhana becomes 4th Indian women cricketer to complete 2500 ODI runs
395.article_body: India Women opener Smriti Mandhana scored her 21st half-century against Pakistan in their ICC Women's ODI World Cup match to become the fourth Indian women cricketer to complete 2500 ODI runs. Mithali Raj, Anjum Chopra and Harmanpreet Kaur are the three other Indian women batters who have achieved the feat. Mandhana has now scored 2,513 runs in 65 ODIs.

396.title: Were released only after I called Amit Shah: Union Min Narayan Rane
396.article_body: After being interrogated for nine hours by Mumbai Police on Saturday in connection with Disha Salian's death case, Union Minister Narayan Rane said that he was released after he called Union Home Minister Amit Shah. Rane, whose son Nitesh was also interrogated, said, "Disha Salian did not die by suicide but was murdered. Mumbai Mayor Kishori Pednekar provoked Salian's mother."

397.title: Pune Metro to start on 2 routes today, min fare is ₹10
397.article_body: The Pune Metro trains will be available for the public after 3 pm today. The trains will currently operate on two routes namely Vanaz-Garware College and PCMC-Phugewalu Metro Station. The minimum fare is ₹10 while the maximum is ₹20. From tomorrow, the metro will operate from 8 am to 9 pm at a frequency of 30 minutes.

398.title: We will miss you: Anupam as co-star Parineeti wraps up 'Uunchai' shoot
398.article_body: Anupam Kher took to Instagram to share that actress Parineeti Chopra has completed shooting for Sooraj Barjatya's 'Uunchai'. "It has been an absolute pleasure working with you #Pari...Stay happy till we meet again! We will MISS you!! Love and prayers always," he wrote. Anupam also shared a video wherein he praised the actress and said that she's full of life.

399.title: Internet services to be suspended in parts of Bengal between March 7 & 16
399.article_body: Mobile internet and broadband services in several regions of West Bengal will be temporarily suspended to prevent unlawful activities, as per an order issued by the state government. The services will remain suspended in a few blocks of Malda, Murshidabad, Uttar Dinajpur, Cooch Behar, Jalpaiguri, Birbhum and Darjeeling between 11 am and 3.15 pm during March 7-9, 11-12 and 14-16.

400.title: He used his points to upgrade me to first class on flight in 1997: Gilchrist on Warne
400.article_body: Talking about Shane Warne, former Australia wicketkeeper Adam Gilchrist said, "His generosity, underestimated by those who didn’t know him, was a strong suit of Warnie's." He added, "I remember flying home with...injury after...Old Trafford Test in 1997 and Warnie was on...same flight because his daughter...was born. We flew home together...He used his points to upgrade me to first class."
